page.title: 11CATHOLICISM IN CLEATOR MOOR
page.content: Mostly older folk attend Mass. Altar boys wear a cassock and cotter which is a blue robe and white top.Sometimes at special masses they wear albs and carry acolytes and the cross bearer goes at the front. The masses usually last about an hour. The priests often try to make the sermons interesting and popular. The priests robes vary in colour acording to the time of year. At Christmas the priests wear white. At Easter they wear red. At Whit week they wear green. At a funeral they wear purple. At a baptism they wear white. Our priests govern our school. Nearly at the end of mass we recieve our Lord. The priest that offers Mass mixes the water and wine, blesses it and drinks it. BY MICHAEL SIMPSON & ANTHONY NICHOLSON.
